result.execSummary:
The defendant Scot J. Eldridge was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Scot J. Eldridge is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Scot J. Eldridge was found guilty of Operate Firearm While Intoxicated, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(b).
  • Scot J. Eldridge was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Scot J. Eldridge was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Scot J. Eldridge

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Voucher, Correspondence, Affidavit Regarding Fees and Expenses and Order For Payment with Statement

Defendant Scot J. Eldridge in court with attorney Wright C. Laufenberg.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls 15CF96 and 15CM133 @ 11:27 a.m. Agreement stated - 15CM133 - plea to ct 2 - forfeiture, cts 1 & 3 dismiss. $100 plus costs. 15CF96 - Def will plead to cts 1, 3, & 4, cts 2 & 6 dismiss and read in, Ct 5 dismiss outright. Cts 1, 3 & 4 withheld sentence, 2 yrs probation, on each, concurrent, AODA and follow through, counseling deemed appropriate, court costs. Atty Laufenberg agrees. Def understands and agrees. Plea quest. reviewed. 15CM133 ct 2 - no contest plea. 15CF96 ct 1 - no contest plea. Ct 3 - no contest plea. Ct 4 - no contest plea. 15CM133 cts 1 & 3 dismissed on motion of State. 15CF96 - cts 2 & 6 dismissed and read in. Ct 5 dismissed outright. Constitutional rights, elements, possible penalties reviewed. Atty Laufenberg satisfied. Court finds Def understands and pleas freely & voluntarily made. Factual basis. Court accepts pleas and finds guilty 15CM133 ct 2 unlawful phone use, 15CF96 cts 1, 3, & 4. Sentencing remarks by Counsel. Statement by Defendant. 15CM133 ct 2 - court approves agreement. $100 plus costs, apply bond, if any balance apply to 15CF96. 15CF96, ct 1 withheld sentence,  2 yrs probation, AODA and follow through, counseling as required, court costs, DNA sample and surcharge. 2 days jail, sentence completed. No credit if revoked. Cts 3  & 4 same sentence, 2 yrs probation, same conditions except jail.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Postconviction rights. Bond in 15CF96 return to poster. Def may stop pmts on atty fees. If balance due when final bill received, will be notified to continue pmts. Any overpmt will be refunded.

Defendant Scot J. Eldridge in court with attorney Wright C. Laufenberg.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls 15CF96 & 15CM133  @ 3:29 pm.  Atty Laufenberg gives statement regarding def. health, Bond continued.  Status conference scheduled for March 30, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Wright C. Laufenberg in court.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls 15CF96 & 15CM133 @ 2:49 pm. Atty Laufenberg advised court def. is in the hospital. Court grants defense adjournment.  Status conference scheduled for January 5, 2016 at 02:45 pm.

Defendant Scot J. Eldridge in court with attorney Wright C. Laufenberg.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls 15CF96 & 15CM133  @ 3:10 pm. Atty Laufenberg waives ph. Waiver of Preliminary Examination Filed. Def. agrees to waive p.h.   Court goes over p.h. rights.  State clarifies that Information will have more charges. Court explains to def. Atty Laufenberg talks to def. Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing on 15CF96. Court accepts waiver. Information Filed.  Court corrects date to 9-22-15.  Atty Laufenberg has copy of information, waives reading, reserve rights & enters Not Guilty plea.  Court receives not guilty plea on 6 ct's. Bond remains.  Status conference scheduled for November 25, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Wright C. Laufenberg in court.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls 15CF96 and 15CM133 @ 10:06 a.m. Statement by Atty Laufenberg, Def in hospital. Court grants continuance. Both cases to be called on 9/22/15.  Waiver of Prelim scheduled for September 22, 2015 at 03:15 pm.

Defendant Scot J. Eldridge in court with attorney Wright C. Laufenberg.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls 15CF96 and 15CM133 @ 9:55 a.m. 15CM133 complaint received, reading waived, reserve juris. objections, not guilty pleas. 15CF96 request prelim but waive time limits  15CM133 Court receives not guilty pleas to all cts. 15CF96 Def does not object to waiver of time limits. Prelim set. 15CM133 to track with status. Pending motion to forfeit bond, to track along. 15CF96 $2,500 cash bond to cover both files.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 26, 2015 at 09:45 am.
for Appointment of An Attorney, Affidavit of Indigency and Order

Defendant Scot J. Eldridge in court.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Def. has applied for court appointed attorney.  Bond continued.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
